Uh, I'd be about as handy with wire and diodes as I would be with a steam s=
hovel, so no worries there!

Robin


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From=
: purplespacefriend<mailto:purplealiengirl@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Friday, February 29, 2008=
 11:08 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Thanks Juli!


  I'd be cautious about l=
ong wire, and the tuner module in #12, a 
  little static build and poof! Y=
ou can use back to back diodes across 
  the wire to help discharge voltage=
 before it gets to high. 

  Frank-S

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mail=
to:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>, Joel Smith <shadow71414@...> wrote:
  >
  > we=
ll now that hill with tree sounds perfect to have ur hubby run 
  some copp=
per wire there and speaker wire #16 or #14 depends on the 
  distance and t=
hat should improve your recption.
  > 
  > joel

l Message ----
  > From: Robin Henson <MudPuddleFarm@...>
  > To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>

 29, 2008 8:51:20 PM
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Thanks Juli!
  > 
  > I just wa=
nted to offer a public thank you to Juli for inviting me 
  > into the reco=
rding group she participates in. I'm excited to join 
  in 
  > but am expe=
riencing some minor technical difficulties at the moment.
  > 
  > ACK! I h=
ave no radio reception! I'm out in the boonies and my house 
  > backs righ=
t up to a tree-covered hill. I'm going to have to find 
  > another private=
 place to do my research.
  > 
  > I had to tag along on errands with hubby=
 and son this afternoon and 
  > brought my RS 470 and digital recorder wit=
h me for the ride. You 
  > shoulda seen their reactions when I started ask=
ing the radio 
  > questions in the car! My son said I was scaring him (gee=
z, he's 
  19), 
  > and my husband said I was like one of the bag ladies w=
e see walking 
  > down the street talking to herself. They're both disappo=
inted in me 
  > for not having a more acceptable hobby like knitting. I st=
ayed in 
  > the car recording when they went into the store, and then I no=
ticed 
  > there was this woman in the car next to me who had been staring =
at 
  me 
  > open-mouthed for God knows how long. I haven't uploaded the 
=
  > recording to the computer yet, but really don't think I got 
  anything=
 
  > besides radio fragment.
  > 
  > Speaking of that, the scan rate seem=
s pretty fast, and yet the 
  > stations each hold for several seconds, so =
I get more like complete 
  > sentences than broadcast "fragments." 
  > 
 =
 > Do you think some people are chosen to be researchers in this 
  field? =

  > I guess I'm feeling a little discouraged right now, but I'll figure 
 =
 > this out soon. 
  > 
  > Robin
